organization: PDXWIT: Portland Women and non-binary people in tech slack channel
note: PDXWIT: Portland Women and non-binary people in tech slack channel. PDXWIT also organizes events, workshops, etc. The slack channel is very busy and a great place to meet folks or look for opportunities in the Portland area

ChickTech is a national organization that provides STEM education for girls and women. The main website has a job board and links to various resources, as well as to the chapter websites in different cities

Out In Tech is a national organization that provides support and community for LGBTQ+ people nationwide. The main website has a job board and links to various resources, as well as to the chapter websites in different cities (see events page)

organization: Project Alloy provides scholarship assistance to URMs in tech to attend conferences.
note: Project Alloy provides scholarship assistance to URMs in tech to attend conferences. The main website has a job board and links to various resources, as well as to the chapter websites in different cities (see events page)

Black Girls Code is a national organization by empowering girls of color ages 7 to 17 to become innovators in STEM fields, leaders in their communities, and builders of their own futures through exposure to computer science and technology. The main website has a job board and links to various resources, as well as to the chapter websites in different cities (see events page)
Google has a very robust program that provides scholarships, job training, travel grants for conferences, networking opportunities, educational opportunities and more
Podcast that features people breaking into tech from non-traditional backgrounds. Also check their twitter acc
Venture Capital funding for women, POC and LGBTQ+ founders
Support organization for founders from underrepresented backgrounds.
Support organization for founders from underrepresented backgrounds.
A tech & art focused festival with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion and an active creative community
STEM arts education for underrepresented teens and young adults
Girls, Inc partners with schools and local organizations to create positive learning experiences and help girls overcome obstacles. They are not solely focused on tech, but related.
Bootcamp comparison and ranking site with a lot of information about tech education, scholarships, advice for success.
International organization that puts together meetups, summits, and other programs including a coding scholarship.
A long list of potential opportunities to receive a scholarship for a code school - curated by Course Report
A long list of tech conferences that provide travel grants and scholarships. This is an open source project anyone can contribute to.
Conference Buddy is an easy way to find linkeminded people to hang out with at conferences - making it easier for new folks and to meet people.
This website provides has an amazing list of free tickets for diverse attendees for tech conferences.
A list of awesome diverse, welcoming tech conferences.
An amazinf conference for junior developers
Microsoft's scholarship program for students in STEM disciplines
Techtown Portland is a citywide initiative to increase diversity in tech. A great project to learn about, especially as pledging companies are committed to diversity.
